name: Charles Drew
bio: Charles Drew was an African American physician who pioneered methods of storing blood plasma for transfusion and organized the first large-scale blood bank in the U.S. His research on blood storage and transfusions saved thousands of lives during World War II.

name: Daniel Hale Williams
bio: Daniel Hale Williams was one of the first physicians to perform open-heart surgery in the United States. He founded Provident Hospital, the first non-segregated hospital in the United States, which also had an affiliated nursing school for African Americans.

name: Elijah McCoy
bio: Elijah McCoy invented an automatic lubricator for oiling steam engines, revolutionizing the railway industry. His high-quality inventions gave rise to the expression 'the real McCoy', meaning the genuine article.

name: Fred Jones
bio: Frederick McKinley Jones was an inventor best known for developing refrigeration equipment for trucks and railroad cars. His portable cooling units helped the formation of the frozen food industry and extended the availability of fresh produce.

name: Garrett Morgan
bio: Garrett Morgan was an inventor and businessman known for inventing a three-position traffic signal and an improved smoke hood (early gas mask). His traffic signal was a significant contribution to public safety.

name: George Washington Carver
bio: George Washington Carver was an agricultural scientist and inventor who developed hundreds of products using peanuts, sweet potatoes, and soybeans. He devoted his life to research projects connected with southern agriculture.

name: Jan Matzeliger
bio: Jan Matzeliger invented the automated shoe lasting machine that would attach the upper part of a shoe to the sole. His invention revolutionized the shoe industry by drastically reducing the cost of manufacturing shoes.

name: Lewis Latimer
bio: Lewis Latimer was an inventor and draftsman best known for his contributions to the patenting of the light bulb and the telephone. He developed a method of producing a more durable carbon filament, making electric lighting more practical and affordable.

name: Madam C.J. Walker
contribution: Hair care products for African American women
bio: Madam C.J. Walker was an entrepreneur, philanthropist, and political and social activist. She is recorded as the first female self-made millionaire in America in the Guinness Book of World Records, having developed a line of cosmetics and hair care products for black women.

name: Percy Julian
bio: Percy Lavon Julian was a research chemist and a pioneer in the chemical synthesis of medicinal drugs from plants. He was the first to synthesize the natural product physostigmine and was a pioneer in the industrial large-scale chemical synthesis of the human hormones progesterone and testosterone from plant sterols.

name: Willis Johnson
bio: Willis Johnson patented an improved egg beater design in 1884. His invention featured two interlocking, hand-cranked whisks that rotated in opposite directions, making the process of beating eggs much more efficient.
